item.title: Report X-2025021105
item.description:
Report X-2025021105

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR NOTICED FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT LEAKING IN A LINE FORM FROM TOP CORNER TO BOTTOM CORNER. AUDITOR NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFED RMP TO SEND A RESPONDER TO THE AUDITOR FLOOR AREA. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET SINCE HAZMAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON IT. RESPONDER READ FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CONTAINERIZE THE FLAMMABLE LQUID HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER CLEANED UP REMAINS OF ZEP ZROBENT AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING AFTER ARRIVING TO THE PSC CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2025021054
item.description:
Report X-2025021054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT BAY 371 WITH FULL PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET BASED ON THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER READ CURRENT FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND USED ZEP ZORBENT TO CONTAIN THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT INTO A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER USED ZEP ZORBENT ON REMAINING SPILL RESIDUE ON THE GRATING AND THE FLOOR. RESPONDER THEN RETURNED TO THE PSC CAGE WITH THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A SPILL TUB. RESPONDER THEN STARTED PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025020712
item.description:
Report X-2025020712

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: MARION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 11th a drum was found during the AM sort that was leaking. The drum was properly marked as UN1263 Paint Related Material, 3, PGIII. It is unknown how the damage occured to cause the leak. The drum was placed into a steel salvage drum and an amended shippers dec was requested.

item.title: Report I-2025020011
item.description:
Report I-2025020011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Passenger had vaping pen on their person and felt it getting hot. Passenger gave it to the flight attendant and there the battery went into thermal runaway and fire was seen coming from the device. Fire was extinguished and device was cooled. Device was then placed in the onboard fire containment bag and more water added. Device was monitored until landing in MDW and then it was given to local SWA Ground Ops personnel. Passenger was not using the device at the time it started getting hot., After landing, passenger deplaned and never spoke with SWA so we could get their information.
